results.name: If n = Product (p_j^k_j) then a(n) = Product ((p_j - 1)*(k_j + 1)).
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Ilya Gutkovskiy, Scatter plot of a(n) up to n=50000
Index entries for sequences computed from indices in prime factorization
Index entries for sequences computed from exponents in factorization of n
formula: a(p^k) = (p - 1)*(k + 1) where p is a prime and k > 0.
a(n) = 2^omega(n)*phi(n) if n is a squarefree (A005117), where omega() = A001221 and phi() = A000010.
program: (PARI) a(n)={my(f=factor(n)); prod(i=1, #f~, my(p=f[i,1], e=f[i,2]); (p-1)*(e+1))} \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Jul 24 2018
results.author: _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, May 12 2018
